401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: page_request.after
parameters.description: The cursor value after which data will be returned.

parameters.name: page_request.sort_by
parameters.description: Sort the response by the given field.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.
Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

delete.description:
Set a stack's `delete_after` value. The stack scheduled for deletion after its `delete_after` date is reached.

Deleting a stack deletes all services on the stack, cannot be stopped after it has started, and is an unrecoverable operation. Services on the stack accrue billable charges until deletion has finished.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

parameters.name: not_before
parameters.description:
The date and time after which a stack should be deleted

If a `not_before` date is not provided then the stack will be marked for deletion one day after the time of the request. Provide a `not_before` date on or before the current date/time to mark the stack for immediate deletion.

401.description: Returned when an unauthorized request is attempted.

post.description: Unset a stack's `delete_after` value, if the `delete_after` value has not already passed. Unsetting this value unschedules its future deletion.

role.description: The name of the role for this binding, formatted as either "roles/<name>" or "accounts/<id>/roles/<name>".

members.description: The members assigned to the roles in this binding, formatted as either "user:<name>" for users or "serviceAccount:<email>" for service accounts.

PolicyBinding.description: An assignment of members to roles

bindings.description: Bindings to assign members to roles

version.description:
The current update number used to ensure updates happen to the expected version.

On first update this must be 0 and on each successive update this must be the last known version. When getting or as the result of a set, this will be the current version.

createdAt.description:
When this policy was created.

Always present on get, ignored on set.

updatedAt.description:
When this policy was last updated.

Could be absent on get if not updated since initial creation. Ignored on set.

iamPolicy.description: A policy on a StackPath resource

totalCount.description: The total number of items in the dataset

hasPreviousPage.description: Whether or not a previous page of data exists

hasNextPage.description: Whether or not another page of data is available

startCursor.description: The cursor for the first item in the set of data returned

endCursor.description: The cursor for the last item in the set of data returned

paginationPageInfo.description:
Information about a paginated response

This is modeled after the GraphQL Relay spec to support both cursor based pagination and traditional offset based pagination.

accountId.description: The ID of the account to create the stack for

slug.description:
The StackPath stack's human-friendly, text-based unique identifier

This can be used in place of a stack's ID in most situations to identify a stack. It can be no larger than 30 characters, each being a lowercase letter, number, or dash. It also cannot start with a dash, end with a dash, or have consecutive dashes.If this value is not present, it is derived from the name. This value cannot be updated.

name.description:
The stack's name

Stack names cannot be empty, cannot be over 255 characters long, and must be unique per account.

stackDeleteStackResponse.description: A response from a request to delete a stack.

stackId.description: The ID of the StackPath stack the policy is on

stackGetIAMPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to retrieve a StackPath stack's policy

stackId.description: The ID of the StackPath stack the policy is on

stackSetIAMPolicyResponse.description: A response from a request to set a StackPath stack's policy

accountId.description: The ID of the account that a stack belongs to

slug.description:
A stack's human-friendly identifier

This can be used in place of a stack's ID in most situations to identify a stack. It can be no longer than 30 characters, each being a lowercase letter, number, or dash. It also cannot start with a dash, end with a dash, or have consecutive dashes. This value can be provided on creation or is derived from the stack's name if a slug isn't provided. This value cannot be updated once it's created.

name.description:
A stack's name

Stack names cannot be empty, cannot be over 255 characters long, and must be unique per account.

createdAt.description: The date a stack was created

updatedAt.description: The date a stack was last updated

deleteAfter.description:
The date that a stack will be processed for deletion

Deletion is processed on or after this time. Stack deletion removes all services on the stack and cannot be halted once begun.

stackStackStatus.description:
A stack's status

 - PENDING: The stack is being created
 - ACTIVE: The stack is active, and all active services on the stack are accessible
 - DISABLED: The stack and its services were disabled by the user
 - SUSPENDED: The stack and its services were suspended and are inaccessible
 - BILLING_SUSPENDED: The stack and its services were suspended by StackPath for billing reasons and are inaccessible
 - DELETED: The stack and its services have been deleted and inaccessible
 - DELETE_REQUESTED: The stack has passed its `delete_after` date and will be deleted
 - DELETE_PROCESSING: Stack deletion has begun and cannot be interrupted
 - SUSPEND_REQUESTED: Stack suspension has been requested
 - SUSPEND_PROCESSING: Stack suspension has started, and services are being suspended
 - UNSUSPEND_REQUESTED: Stack un-suspension has been requested
 - UNSUSPEND_PROCESSING: Stack un-suspension has begin, and services are being re-activated

permissions.description: The set of permissions to test

stackId.description: The ID of the StackPath stack the permissions were tested on

permissions.description: The set of permissions that the calling user does have on the stack

stackTestIAMPermissionsResponse.description: A response from a request to test permissions on a StackPath account

stackUndeleteStackResponse.description: A response from a request to undelete a stack.

name.description:
The stack's new name

Stack names cannot be empty, cannot be over 255 characters long, and must be unique per account.
